text:
Hi guys I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen I want to share with

you my recipe for a classic potato salad,
like an American style potato salad. This

does have mayonnaise but I can promise you
it is not going to be gloopy and flavorless

and just ehh. It is going to be creamy, full
of flavor, and absolutely delicious. I am

going to show you all of the ingredients you
will need in a bit but we are going to start

with the potatoes which is what I have in
front of me. Now, I have got some russet potatoes

here and all I am doing, I have them on a
baking sheet and I am just pricking them with

a fork just a few places. Now, most people
boil their potatoes to make potato salad and

you absolutely can do that. I on the other
hand happen to think that if you bake your

potatoes until they are nice and fluffy you
get a much better texture because they will

be really dry on the inside but they will
be really soft and fluffy and I personally

prefer them that way. So I have got my oven
pre-heated to 375. I have my potatoes on my

baking sheet and I am going to pop them into
the oven for an hour to an hour in a half

until how ever long it takes for them to get
nice, soft, and tender. I promise you this

step might seem like it is an extra step but
think about it, less cleaning up to do you

are just putting potatoes on a baking sheet
and popping them in the oven. It is just going

to provide such a great texture for your potato
salad. No water anywhere near it which can

be a problem and make it really sort of soggy
and then it mixes with the mayonnaise and

then gets all messy. This is perfection, so
I am going to pop this into the oven, let

them bake and get nice and tender, and I will
show you what they look like and show you

the next step once we get them all nice and
fully cooked. My potatoes baked for about

an hour and a quarter and I have let them
cool completely. And now I am going to do

is I am going to split them down and they
are beautiful and perfectly cooked. Now, before

we go any farther I am going to show you the
rest of the ingredients you will need which

is some good quality mayo, sour cream, yellow
mustard, hard boiled eggs, finely chopped

dill pickles these are little baby pickles
that I finely chopped, chopped up scallions,

parsley, dill, white wine vinegar, paprika,
granulated garlic, salt, and pepper, and that

is it. Before I go any farther with the potatoes
I am actually going to mix things up in here.

I am going to add my vinegar and my granulated
garlic and paprika along with my salt and

pepper, make sure you put plenty of salt because
potatoes need salt otherwise they will taste

like nothing. After you have added that give
it a good whisking, stir, whatever you want

to call it. I am just using my spatula and
you do not have to use my exact ingredients

that I am using I am just showing you my favorite
ingredients for a classic potato salad. As

you can see I am not making a ton of dressing
because I think that is the thing that can

ruin a really good potato salad is when you
add so much in there that it is overpowering

and gloopy. Now, a lot of people take a potato
masher and mash their potatoes before they

put it in a potato salad because a classic
potato salad is not chunky at all. I just

take a spoon and this is what I do. I run
it down, right, I just run it like so that

way some pieces like this piece right here
is a bit bigger the rest are much smaller

and you can by all means leave it really chunky
you do not have to roast the potatoes like

I did you can totally just put them in boiling
water and boil them however you like. This

is just my favorite way of doing it I just
think because the potatoes are nice and dry

it provides like the best blanket for that
dressing. So I am just going to continue to

get all my potatoes in the bowl and then toss
the rest of our ingredients. To my potatoes

I am going to add my hard boiled eggs, which
to me is another crucial ingredient. And then

no potato salad would ever be complete without
dill pickles. I am a dill pickles kind of

girl, no bread and butter here please, I love
dill pickles so lots of them for me. And then

I like to do scallions, dill a must, and a
little bit of parsley. Then all you got to

do, and I, see potato salad is one of those
things where it is a matter of preference.

If you do not like paprika then do not add
paprika in and you will have a white sauce.

I just like to add a little bit in and it
just gives it more flavor. If you like your

potatoes really chunky leave them chunky but
I like my potatoes really creamy so as you

can see what I am doing I am using my spatula
and kind of giving everything a mush because

that is how I like my potato salad. But again
matter of preference and you can see it is

not gloopy at all it is just beautifully coated
in that dressing. I am so excited to give

this a try, very excited about that. That
looks good enough to me right. Lets give it

a go. Where is the pickle, there it is. That
is money. Hands down the best classic potato

salad around. Full of flavor, not gloopy and
gloppy, you can taste each individual ingredient

really well. But they all go together really
well as well so that you get everything in

one bite and it just goes perfectly together
if that makes any sense. The potatoes are

exactly how I like them and I wanted you to
kind of see, I think see there is no liquid,

there is no moisture on the bottom of the
bowl. That I think in my opinion anyway partly

because of the amount of dressing that we
made but a lot of it has to do with the fact

that we roasted our potatoes, we baked our
potatoes instead of boiling them because when

you boil them there is a chance of water and
moisture surrounding the potato and this just

is perfection. I am going to cover this and
pop it in the refrigerator for about a half

hour before serving and I suggest you do the
same so the flavors can all meld much better

together. Laurainthekitchen.com will have
the recipe waiting for you. I hope you enjoyed

spending time with me. Make this classic one,
let me know how you like it and I will see
you next time. Bye! Bye!
